history.proof: unfold Zp_plus. apply nat2Zp_inj. apply rem_plus.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pred _%nat_scope

mscal_0 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u x : X), mscal m u 0 x = u
mk_monoid : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), (forall x : X, m u x = x) -> (forall x : X, m x u = x) -> (forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z) -> monoid_theory m u
mscal_S : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (x : X), mscal m u (S n) x = m x (mscal m u n x)
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
Record monoid_theory (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) : Prop := mk_monoid { monoid_unit_l : forall x : X, m u x = x; monoid_unit_r : forall x : X, m x u = x; monoid_assoc : forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z } Arguments monoid_theory [X]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments mk_monoid [X]%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _ _)%function_scope
Nat.add_sub_eq_nz : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n - m = p -> m + p = n
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
rem_plus_div : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a b : nat, divides p b -> rem a p = rem (a + b) p
bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
bezout_generalized : forall p q : nat, {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l}}}}
Zp_plus_assoc : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊕ y ⊕ z
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
Zp_zero_is_one = conj (fun H : Zp = Op => let H0 : proj1_sig Zp = proj1_sig Op := f_equal (proj1_sig (P:=fun x : nat => x < p)) H in let H1 : rem 1 p = 0 := eq_sym H0 in (fun H2 : rem 1 p = 0 => let H3 : forall q p : nat, rem q p = 0 -> divides p q := fun q p : nat => match divides_rem_eq q p with | conj _ x0 => x0 end in let H4 : divides p 1 := H3 1 p H2 in let H5 : p = 1 := divides_1_inv H4 in H5) H1) (fun H : p = 1 => Zp_inj Zp Op (eq_ind_r (fun p : nat => p <> 0 -> 0 = rem 1 p) (fun Hp : 1 <> 0 => eq_ind_r (fun n : nat => 0 = n) eq_refl (rem_diag Hp)) H Hp)) : Zp = Op <-> p =...
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
Nat2Pos.inj_add : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m <> 0 -> Pos.of_nat (n + m) = (Pos.of_nat n + Pos.of_nat m)%positive
Zp_plus_comm : forall x y, x ⊕ y = y ⊕ x
Zp_plus_inj_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ y = x ⊕ z -> y = z
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Zp_opp_plus_eq : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ y = z < -> x = z ⊕ ∸ y
utils_nat.first_non_zero : forall (f : nat -> nat) (n : nat), f 0 = 0 -> f n <> 0 -> exists i : nat, i < n /\ (forall k : nat, k <= i -> f k = 0) /\ f (i + 1) <> 0
Zp_opp_plus : forall x y, ∸ (x ⊕ y) = ∸ x ⊕ ∸ y
Zp_eq_dec : forall x y, {x = y} + {x <> y}
Nat.add_pred_l : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> Nat.pred n + m = Nat.pred (n + m)
Nat.add_pred_r : forall n m : nat, m <> 0 -> n + Nat.pred m = Nat.pred (n + m)
Nat.eq_dec : forall n m : nat, {n = m} + {n <> m}
rem_plus : forall p a b : nat, rem (a + b) p = rem (rem a p + rem b p) p
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
Pos2Nat.inj_add : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat (p + q) = Pos.to_nat p + Pos.to_nat q
rem_plus_rem : forall p a b : nat, rem (a + rem b p) p = rem (a + b) p
Zp_mult_plus_distr_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊗ y ⊕ x ⊗ z
Zp_mult_plus_distr_r : forall x y z : Z_Zp, (y ⊕ z) ⊗ x = y ⊗ x ⊕ z ⊗ x

```coq
unfold Zp_plus. f_equal. apply nat2Zp_inj. apply rem_plus. apply nat2Zp_inj. apply nat2Zp_invertible. apply is_gcd_comm. apply nat2Zp_inj in Hp. apply nat2Zp_inj in Hp. apply nat2Zp_surj in u. destruct u as [u' [H1 H2]]. apply nat2Zp_surj in v. destruct v as [v' [H3 H4]]. apply nat2Zp_inj. rewrite rem_plus_div. apply Hp. exists (div u' p + div v' p). exists (rem u' p + rem v' p). split. + rewrite Nat.mul_add_distr_l. rewrite Nat.mul_add_distr_r. rewrite <- Nat.add_assoc. rewrite <- Nat.add_assoc. f_equal. f_equal. apply eq_sym. apply rem_plus. + intros H. apply Hp. apply Nat.add_cancel_r with (m:=rem u' p). rewrite H. apply rem_lt. apply Hp. apply H4.
Qed.```
